intro: Anapodophyllum peltatum, commonly known as the broadleaf anapodophyllum, is a unique plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring season. Its botanical structure includes a short stem with a single, unbranched root system. Anapodophyllum peltatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
